DataElement.preferredName: Breast Cancer Treatment Outcomes Scale Other Status Rib Pain Difference Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated evaluation of any rib, using a four point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Breast Cancer Treatment Outcomes Scale Other Status Rib Pain Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A measure of perceived aesthetics after breast-conserving surgical treatment and radiotherapy._A person's stated observation of the difference in breast shape between the treated and untreated breast since treatment for breast cancer._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._A feeling of tension or tightness in one or more muscles._One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.Any one of the paired bones, 12 on either side, extending from the thoracic vertebrae toward the median line on the ventral aspect of the trunk. The long curved bones which form the rib cage. Generally, ribs 1 to 7 are connected to the sternum by their costal cartilages and are called true ribs, whereas ribs 8 to 12 are termed false ribs._A disorder characterized by the sensation of marked discomfort, distress or agony.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Breast Cancer Treatment Outcomes Scale - Cosmetic Status
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A measure of perceived aesthetics after breast-conserving surgical treatment and radiotherapy.

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer Treatment Outcomes Scale-Cosmetic Status
Concepts.definition: A measure of perceived aesthetics after breast-conserving surgical treatment and radiotherapy.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any one of the paired bones, 12 on either side, extending from the thoracic vertebrae toward the median line on the ventral aspect of the trunk. The long curved bones which form the rib cage. Generally, ribs 1 to 7 are connected to the sternum by their costal cartilages and are called true ribs, whereas ribs 8 to 12 are termed false ribs.:A disorder characterized by the sensation of marked discomfort, distress or agony.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: Any one of the paired bones, 12 on either side, extending from the thoracic vertebrae toward the median line on the ventral aspect of the trunk. The long curved bones which form the rib cage. Generally, ribs 1 to 7 are connected to the sternum by their costal cartilages and are called true ribs, whereas ribs 8 to 12 are termed false ribs.
A disorder characterized by the sensation of marked discomfort, distress or agony.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The quality of being unlike or dissimilar._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::4_The precise location of something; a spatially limited location._An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of considerable or relatively great size, extent, or capacity.

Concepts.definition: Of considerable or relatively great size, extent, or capacity.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The quality of being unlike or dissimilar.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::4:The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.:an ordered reference standard.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being unlike or dissimilar.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
